radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Did not reveal any findings of acute disease; the spleen appeared small measuring 8 cm with at least two granulomas and mild enlargement of the caudate lobe of the liver.
Showed elevation of the left hemidiaphragm with no evidence of pneumonia.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Consistent with pulmonary edema, bilateral hilar fullness, and a pleural effusion on the left side; findings progressed over time.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Revealed no evidence of hemorrhage, masses, or infarction.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Radiographs of the right hand and forearm
radiographic_examinations.findings: Showed soft-tissue swelling, reticulation consistent with edema, with no evidence of soft-tissue gas.
Showed interstitial opacities and bilateral hilar fullness consistent with pulmonary edema, and new blunting of the left costophrenic angle indicating pleural effusion.
